spec: Parse complex scientific units in text (e.g., 'kg·m^2/s^3', 'J/(mol·K)') and, when a numeric value is present (e.g., '9.81 m/s^2'), convert that numeric value to a specified target unit preserving unit algebra or fail with an unconvertible error.

Extract key-value pairs from free-form text where keys appear in brackets like '[Name] John Doe' or as 'Name=John', normalize keys to lowercase_with_underscores, and return a JSON object mapping keys to values.
inputs: Registration: FirstName=Jane LastName=Smith Age=29 Country=United States
Profile - [Full Name]: Dr. Emily Zhang; [DOB] 1985-07-23; [Member ID] #A12345
Contact: email=pilot@example.org; Phone=+1-800-555-0199; [Address] 742 Evergreen Terrace, Springfield

Order details: [Order Number] 00012345
Item=Wireless Mouse
Quantity=2
Price=25.99

Notes: [Project Name] Apollo-X
Lead=O'Connor, Sean
Start Date=01/15/2024
Status=[Status] In progress
SKU=ZX-99; [Description] High-performance GPU; Warranty=3 years; [Manufacturer] NVIDIA Corp.

spec: Repair near-JSON text by removing trailing commas, converting single quotes to double quotes, stripping JS-style comments, and quoting unquoted object keys; return valid JSON or an error indicator if unrecoverable.
Strip HTML tags while preserving meaningful whitespace, convert HTML entities to characters (e.g., & -> &), collapse consecutive spaces/newlines to single spaces, and return cleaned plain text.

Transform free-form recipe ingredient lines (e.g., '1 1/2 cups sifted all-purpose flour') into JSON objects {quantity: number, unit: standardized_unit, ingredient: normalized_string} handling mixed fractions, approximations (e.g., 'about'), and common unit synonyms.
inputs: ½ tsp freshly ground black pepper

spec: Find measurements with simple units in text (e.g., '3.5 kg', '12in', '100 cm') and replace each with its SI base unit equivalent (meters for length, kilograms for mass) rounded to two decimal places.
inputs: The package weighs 3.5 kg and is 12in long.
A newborn baby is about 50 cm tall and weighs 7 lb.
Cut the board to 2ft 3in and drill a 10mm hole.
The racing track is 1.5 km per lap and pole vault crossbar is at 15ft.
Recipe calls for 300 g of flour and 2 oz of butter.
The beam is 6 yards long and weighs 120 lb.
Distance to the moon recorded as 238900 miles in the old report; sensor recorded 384400 km.
outputs: The package weighs 3.50 kg and is 0.30 m long.
A newborn baby is about 0.50 m tall and weighs 3.18 kg.
Cut the board to 0.69 m and drill a 0.01 m hole.
The racing track is 1500.00 m per lap and pole vault crossbar is at 4.57 m.
Recipe calls for 0.30 kg of flour and 0.06 kg of butter.
The beam is 5.49 m long and weighs 54.43 kg.
Phone thickness: 0.01 m; screen diagonal: 0.15 m.
Distance to the moon recorded as 384472281.60 m in the old report; sensor recorded 384400000.00 m.
